item.title: Equity in Publishing & Open Science Initiative
item.dc:creator: Anneliese Taylor
item.description:
Jill, Ariel, and I have embarked on a new project and we’d love to get your feedback. We will be building a network of faculty journal editors and connecting this network with often-underrepresented groups including early career faculty and researchers and those from groups underrepresented in medicine (UIM). The network ...

Read moreEquity in Publishing & Open Science Initiative

item.title: Alan Daniel’s Retirement
item.dc:creator: Anneliese Taylor
item.description:
Please join me in congratulating Alan Daniel on his retirement after 28 years working at the UCSF Library! Alan started out as a Library Assistant II doing acquisitions and database work in the Resources Management unit (later renamed Collection Management). He worked his way up to a Library Assistant V ...

Read moreAlan Daniel’s Retirement

item.title: Open Access Week activities
item.dc:creator: Anneliese Taylor
item.description:
It’s Open Access Week this week, and you’re invited to participate! Even Stephen Hawking is celebrating OA Week, by making his 1966 doctoral thesis OA. Here’s what’s going on at and near UCSF: “Open in order to…”is the theme for this year’s OA Week, and we’re running a campaign to get ...

Read moreOpen Access Week activities

item.title: Thank a Colleague Award – Susan Boone
item.dc:creator: Anneliese Taylor
item.description:
Michael Foster nominated Susan for her quick and ready assistance at the Service Desk on June 26 when no regular opening staff were available. Susan helped patrons at the Service Desk and put up a sign to direct patrons until the doors could all be unlocked. Congratulations, Susan, on your ...

Read moreThank a Colleague Award – Susan Boone

item.title: UCSF Library’s eScholarship Site
item.dc:creator: Anneliese Taylor
item.description:
The Library now has a departmental space on eScholarship, UC’s institutional repository. Departmental spaces – also called academic units or research units on eScholarship – are designed to showcase a unit’s scholarly output. All content in eScholarship is openly accessible to anyone, anywhere online, and is discoverable via search engines. ...

Read moreUCSF Library’s eScholarship Site

item.title: UCSF signs on to the Open Access 2020 Initiative
item.dc:creator: Anneliese Taylor
item.description:
As you heard in last Friday’s staff meeting and from the post on the Library web page, UCSF is announcing today its support for the Open Access 2020 initiative. The reason this is such a big deal is both 1) the scope of what OA2020 is trying to accomplish, and ...

Read moreUCSF signs on to the Open Access 2020 Initiative

item.title: Welcome Stephanie “Teddy” Gomes!
item.dc:creator: Anneliese Taylor
item.description:
I’m pleased to announce that Stephanie Gomes, who goes by Teddy, will be joining the UCSF Library today as the new Open Access Projects Assistant. She’ll be working with me part time over the next several months to increase participation with the UC Open Access Policy and on assessing UCSF ...

Read moreWelcome Stephanie “Teddy” Gomes!

item.title: Share your Work on eScholarship – December 6 event
item.dc:creator: Anneliese Taylor
item.description:
This event is for Library staff, at 10:00 am on December 6th: Have you been wanting to share your published works openly but haven’t gotten around to it? Don’t miss this opportunity to find out how to share your works on the University of California’s eScholarship platform from the experts! ...

item.title: Temporary Position for Open Access Projects
item.dc:creator: Anneliese Taylor
item.description:
There is a position open for a temporary, part-time open access projects assistant. The position will help with implementation of the Open Access Policy vis-a-vis the UC Publication Management System, as well as doing analysis of UCSF’s open access publication output. The position description is posted on the Library’s job ...

item.title: The Many Paths to Open Access
item.dc:creator: Anneliese Taylor
item.description:
At today’s Library Updates meeting I gave a talk about what’s going on with open access publishing. There’s alot of activity right now around OA publishing as well as some initiatives to transition institutions towards OA on a large scale. Here are my slides from the presentation, including notes to ...
